In my notation I gave this move an !-mark, but it is so long ago that I have forgotten why. Can anyone help me?

This move sacrifices my bishop, obviously. I gave it a !? in my notation. I did not need to play that particular move; I just needed to "pass" a move so that my opponent could take my bishop and allow my attack to start.

This has to be a blunder. Perhaps my opponent was after 15.Qxh5 Bxg5, neutralising my attack. But he must have overlooked this continuation:

1-0. Black resigned. His only way of preventing checkmate was to sacrifice his queen for my knight. In retrospect I now believe that if he had not played 14...Nh5?? my opponent could have prevented my queen from entering the action and neutralised my attack.
